content:
The finale of Servant's first season is a topic of much debate among viewers.

Without giving away too many spoilers, I can say that the finale provides some closure on certain plot threads, but it also raises new questions and ends on a cliffhanger. It's a bit of a mixed bag, really.

The finale ties up some loose ends regarding the mystery surrounding Jericho, the baby, and the nanny, but it also introduces new twists and revelations that will keep you wondering what's to come in future seasons.

You'll get some answers, but you'll also be left with a lot of questions, particularly about the true nature of the characters and their motivations. The finale sets up some intriguing possibilities for future seasons, but it may not provide the kind of closure some viewers were hoping for.

If you're someone who likes a more definitive conclusion to a season, you might find the finale a bit frustrating. However, if you're okay with a more ambiguous ending that sets up future plotlines, you'll likely find the finale satisfying.

M. Night Shyamalan has said in interviews that he always intended for Servant to be a multi-season story, so the finale is designed to set the stage for what's to come. If you're invested in the characters and the world, you'll likely be eager to see where the story goes from here.
